alert.note: Alert for Butler; Colfax; Dodge; Madison; Platte; Stanton (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 4:17AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Madison, Colfax, eastern Platte, northwestern Dodge, central Butler and southern Stanton Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 417 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles southeast of Creston, or 16 miles north of Columbus, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Clarkson around 435 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Howells, Dodge and Snyder. People attending Pawnee Park in Columbus should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Nebraska. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Colfax; Dodge; Madison; Platte; Stanton
